sentences.en: ‘It’s not true,’ she said, in a quavering voice.
Her voice was pitched unusually low to suppress the quaver.
sentences.cn: 她声音异常沉着,好把嗓子里的震颤压下去.

sentences.en: I quaver when speaking to large audiences.
sentences.cn: 对许多人讲话时我便会发颤.

sentences.en: Miss Su cursed him in Chinese. Her voice seemed to have a quaver in it.
sentences.cn: 苏小姐用中文骂他, 声音似乎微颤.

sentences.en: She restrained herself with difficulty from showing a quaver in her voice.
sentences.cn: 她努力克制住自己,不让自己的声音发抖.

sentences.en: The sign on the wall seemed to quaver under a film of sliding warm water.
sentences.cn: 墙上的招牌好象在一层浮动的融融的水流下颤动.

sentences.en: There was a quaver in Beryl's voice.
sentences.cn: 贝丽尔的声音有一丝颤抖.

sentences.en: There was a quaver in her voice.
You could hear the quaver in her voice.
sentences.cn: 她的声音中能听出有些颤抖.

trans.tran_en: a musical note which continues for an eighth of the length of a semibreve
if your voice quavers, it shakes as you speak, especially because you are nervous or upset

trans.tran_cn: 颤抖，震动，发颤音，（声音）发颤
颤抖着说[唱]，用颤音演奏
